definition[0]: the real price or cost of something, decided by a market rather than calculated or fixed, for example by a government
example[0]: Restrictive gas contracts required the company to purchase its gas at prices far above market rates.
definition[1]: a typical rate for something on a market at a particular time
example[1]: This measure will force credit card issuers to change from fixed to flexible rates, which would rise and fall with market rates.
definition[2]: the price of something calculated in relation to what buyers are willing to pay at a particular time
example[2]: The spread between the official and the market rate has remained at less than 1% for the past five years.
